intro: Anthocleista nobilis, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and palmate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
